Description: Wall sherd (mended from numerous fragments) of Aeolian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; cream slip; interior glazed; exterior: from top, part of grazing goat frieze (only one hoof from a goat remaining) to right; two dotted lozenges as filling ornament; below, wide black band between two dilute lines; below, animal frieze (human with added purple on body and hair to right confronting large dog with added purple on belly and neck to left; hind leg and one front hoof of goat to right); maeanders, pendant triangles, crosses with dotted chevrons, short zigzags, dashes, dashed crosses, dotted rosettes, and dotted lozenges as filling ornament; below, wide band between two dilute lines; at the foot, frieze of double-outlined tongues with short dotted spike in the interstices; below, black band.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Curator's comments: As noted by Iren, Ist.Mitt. 52 (2002) 185, humans are rare on vases of the group; she outlines possibilities of this man's presence; the object he holds is unfortunately not well preserved, but is not a simple stick or leash; he also has a curious neck band.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.242, no.2)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (no.83)
Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p.122 fig. 4, Appendix 2 Nau3)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 51)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.07)
